ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] (OT) Tech problem, any suggestions?
ygData.msgSnippet: Well actually i think im lucky.  I opened up my pc.  My internal case fan was unplugged and 2 out of my 3 cpu fans were dead (ack!).  Turns out the 2 fans that
ygData.messageBody:
Well actually i think im lucky. I opened up my pc. My internal case fan
was unplugged and 2 out of my 3 cpu fans were dead (ack!). Turns out the 2
fans that have a common power plug on the mother board seem to have a faulty
plug. I swapped it so that 2 of the 3 fans are on the other reliable power
plug and that the third fan is on the faulty one (it goes on and off).
Since i've fixed all my fans the pc has yet to hang, and i've done a couple
of 4-5 hours sprints of gaming and everything is ok woot. No upgrading just
yet...

Minkin

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel P. Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
Sent: January 25, 2001 3:05 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] (OT) Tech problem, any suggestions?


Well that is also true of any of the OS's based on the 9X Kernel (hehe well
any Microsoft OS). I'm not a *nix geek (but I play one on TV <g>) but I
can't help being critical.

Slyde
-----Original Message-----
From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 25, 2001 1:15 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] (OT) Tech problem, any suggestions?

My understanding is that ME really allows 3D games to perform, but has
inherent instabilities and other issues that make it a less-than-desirable
platform. Win2k, on the other hand, apparently has the stability, which
comes at the cost of speed, due to security features. I just wanted some
responses from people with practical experience in the matter. Thanks!

Talies
